title: Why Does No One Use the PIck Intent?
body: As the title says why do like 10% of people in my games not use pick intent in lobby, its a really good tool for forming comps and adjusting to your team.

replies.body: I think it's because some people think that it's funny to ban pick intents.

> [{quoted}](name=ForwardSkies,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=mKWddppb,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-07-21T21:50:38.935+0000)
>
> I think it's because some people think that it's funny to ban pick intents.

This.
Probably because people in low Elo should try to stick to what they know rather than forcing themselves to play something they aren't comfortable with
I'd rather know if i needed to play someone tanky if we dont have enough frontline, or someone more damage oriented if we have lots of tank.

> [{quoted}](name=dragon poo,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=mKWddppb,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-07-21T14:03:42.190+0000)
>
> I'd rather know if i needed to play someone tanky if we dont have enough frontline, or someone more damage oriented if we have lots of tank.

I don't think you need a website to tell you that
What? I'm talking about the pick intent in ranked champ select, what does our comment even mean?

Honestly the main reason i don't (which is invalid now) was that it used to give completely away if you had that preference picked early, now i just don't do it out of that habit.

But i pick around both teams anyway.
